website_summaries.verdict: Streamlined version of the ever-popular model, which still includes all the premium features and perks. ADA-approved.
pros: Offers 10 convenient pulse settings to accommodate all users, delivering a whopping 1,400 pulses per minute
Great investment in well-rounded dental care, as it includes 7 different heads, including a plaque seeker and Pik pocket
cons: Touted to be a quieter model than its predecessor, but users felt otherwise

customer_reviews.title: Squirted out dirty, black particles
customer_reviews.text: I may have gotten a defective one but it kept spurting black water out. I put it together properly (not rocket science), put in clean water and ran it s instructed before putting it in my mouth. As I was about to turn off the test drive and use it , it squirted out black water! It kept doing that every few seconds throughout the cycle. I tried to run water through it a few times but nothing worked. Update - after reading many reviews I think the unit was filled with MOLD! I cannot believe they sold me a unit like this. It obviously was not new. Disgusting and dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Great unit + Waterpik honored the warranty too!!
customer_reviews.text: I love to Waterpik! Purchased in November 2017, after an older Waterpik wore out after about 9 years of almost daily use. Unfortunately, the motor on this one stopped working a few weeks ago for some reason and I was very reluctant/hesitant to bother with a warranty claim, as it always seems like a hassle. So I started shopping other brands. I also decided to take a chance and reach out to Waterpik to see what their warranty experience was like. To my pleasant surprise, Waterpik was gracious, and after answering a few simple questions, they agreed to send a replacement unit! Nice!! Made my day!! Thank you, Waterpik!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performance has changed.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased waterpik ADA machines for about 10 years now. They need replacing about every 2-3 years or so. I have found the quality of the device r/t longevity of the device has drastically decreased. I purchased one just a year or so ago. Then motor quit. Purchased the present one this past July and it leaks constantly into the seat of the resevoir and out the bottom of the device onto and down the counter. And it hesitates to power on frequently. Please advise? I would request a return and refund but like I typed, I bought it just this July and have put up with the failings, but no more. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product...Faulty company!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great...but...it stopped working after 6 months. I called Waterpik to get some help. It turns out, they redesigned the motor and the result is it trips GFCI sockets. The part that makes me angry is they know about the problem and won’t replace my unit with one that won’t trip my GFCI socket. WHAT COMPANY DOES THAT!!!??? For that, their product gets 1 star because that’s the lowest I can go!!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Waterpik works but not as smoothly as believed it would
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a cordless Waterpik that broke, I purchased this as a replacement due to the positive reviews and "Amazon's Choice" selection. While it works, the cord that connects the actual pik to the tank is not flexible (perhaps that will change in time?) and the little motor was louder than anticipated. Next time around, I'm going back to the cordless all in one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Shame on me!
customer_reviews.text: I disregarded the negative reviews after I replaced my first one, thinking this model was improved. But alas, the new one I purchased has now failed completely after giving haphazard performance for the last couple of months. I suspect that this product is an expensive example of time predetermined mechanical failure, either intentionally or inadvertently included in its design. Nevertheless, I have purchased two so far but as the dog says , "kick me once, shame on you; kick me twice, shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Messy messy messy
customer_reviews.text: So my dentist recommended I get one of these to aid in my flossing because it blasts in there better than floss gets in and prevents periodontal disease and what not. It says to not use at full power but I find it's the only way to get in there deep. The cord is short and the picks cable is short as well. I attach it to an extension cord and use it in my shower because the splash gets everywheres. You can't use this at a sink cleanly. I prefer using Luke warm water. Feels better on my gums than ice cold. It has lots of attachments but the only one that you need is the fine pressure one.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: This is overall a good Water flosser. However, the unit is definitely overpriced in general. The material is nothing extraordinary and it should not be so expensive. 4 stars because the unit is very noisy, please watch the video and see how noisy it is at the minimum level. When I change to maximum level it is even louder. Additionally, Costco offers a better price. I was, therefore, disappointed with the price offered here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is my first water flosser. So far I love it. It’s easy to use and cuts maintenance time so I can get out the door or to bed. I wanted to post pics so you to see the size of the unit as I couldn’t really tell the space utilization. It’s compact and and blends in.
customer_reviews.author: seymour5000

customer_reviews.title: Gave up the ghost after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Waterpik in December 2015. It failed in the middle of May this year, after 18 months. Motor/pump started to slow down in April and quit completely in May. Comes with a 3-year warranty. Now trying to return it....to be continued. Bought a 2nd one May 23, hoping for a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf Reisgies

customer_reviews.title: Could cause severe sensitivity to your teeth
customer_reviews.text: I started using the WaterPik on a regular basis. I’ve had it for just over a month. I stopped using it a couple weeks ago because I was having such sensitivity with teeth on my upper right side, was such pain with hot and cold foods. I’ve been doing some research on this because after thinking about what could cause such a change in such a short time, the only thing that was different was me using the WaterPik.I just wanted to post this because I believe the WaterPik has caused severe sensitivity to my teeth. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking after just 4 uses.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a different brand and I wanted one of my own. I bought this based on the commercial I had just seen on tv. It worked great for about 4 uses then started leaking everywhere after that. You turn it on and there is water coming out of the on/off switch, the tube to the "wand" the head unit itself........really disappointed! After 6 uses its now pretty much just garbage and I will have to throw it away because I never kept the box. Lesson learned there I guess.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I am returning. Leaked out of the stem and another place where hose goes in. Plastic junk
customer_reviews.author: sixfourlion

customer_reviews.title: Wish I’d taken advice
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job blasting particles from between my teeth. Feels good on gums. No issues with the waterpik. I’m a dedicated flosser & don’t use this near as often as I thought I would. I don’t have extra counter space for it to hang out on so it goes under the cabinet. It’s faster to floss than pull the thing out, fill the water, plug it in, blast my teeth, drain the thing (don’t like mold), wrap the cord, shove it back under the sink, & wipedown the splashed countertop. It’s just a whole process that makes this a waste of money. Know what you’re going to do with it. It’s a good product if it’s easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: K. SheridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement over older models
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd waterpik in 20 years, so far everything is great. I like the whitening tablet nice detail. I may not buy them on a monthly basis but they seem to improve the color of my teeth. Overall nice unit I like that the additional tips are in a separate container than in the lid they will stay cleaner that way. The on/off switch on the handle is much better than the button it would stick after a year or so and it keeps the water off the mirror much better also.
customer_reviews.author: Tim J.

customer_reviews.title: I actually enjoy doing my teeth now instead of dreading it.
customer_reviews.text: I'd heard about these things before but I never dreamed I would like having one so much. I've always hated manual flossing with a passion. This is so much nicer and I really enjoy keeping my teeth clean now. It's much more pleasant than pulling floss between my teeth. My teeth feel so much cleaner after I use this so I use it twice a day. I love it. It is a little noisy, but not bad. I wish I had gotten one years ago because I actually enjoy doing my teeth now instead of dreading it. I also like this size as it doesn't take up much space on the counter. It's light and easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: NtheNite

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design. Looks perfect when placed to the left ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design. Looks perfect when placed to the left rear of the sink. Hose does not tangle up like the older models. Reservoir has a hinge top door to keep the water sterile. Precise throttle control with plenty of pressure. Refreshing, like a breath mint. Not sure it really whitens teeth though. We do not notice a difference.after using the product daily for a month. Buy it. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: UPSET
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a gift for Christmas. I just received it....it was shipped in its original box which looks like it went through the wringer. I am going to open the box and make sure it is not broken and that all the parts and pieces are ok, but I am a little annoyed with Amazon. I do not want something that looks used and abused for a Christmas present and I expect them to know better than to ship it its original box.
customer_reviews.author: Dande

customer_reviews.title: I love my Waterpik
customer_reviews.text: I love my Waterpik, it has totally changed how I feel about flossing my teeth. My teeth are very close together and regular floss gets caught and feels like I am going to pull my crowns and veneers off. The Waterpik gets my teeth cleaner than regular floss and doesn't hurt. I did get sprayed in the face the first time I used it but that's just because I didn't realize that you always want to turn the brush part off before you turn the unit on. That just makes sense. The whitening feature works really well too.
customer_reviews.author: F18fdg

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, much nicer than the white option. The white colored one gets stains after a while and you really don't feel like using it anymore. The black is so much nicer and cleaner. The massage feature is really nice and I use that a lot. The only negative comment is that there is only 2 spots for the heads. The old model had storage for all the heads. If you haven's ever used a waterpik, please do yourself a favor and get it, it is a great tool to keep our teeth heathy clean and in great shape. Highly recommend this product and the black color.
customer_reviews.author: Nino

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. BUT lasted 3 months to the DAY! 😠 now motor not pumping
customer_reviews.author: Janice D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: ordered this to replace an aging but loved WP60/65. This Aquarius does not have half the ...
customer_reviews.text: ordered this to replace an aging but loved WP60/65. This Aquarius does not have half the water pressure of the WP60, which makes it useless for me. The water reservoir is also way too small, (needs 3 refills during a session) and has a useless lid that is completely in the way and makes the use annoying. This is near "what were they thinking?" territory. Bottom line, the classic WP 60/65 / 72 are by far the better designs. I returned this and got the WP72, same as the 60/65, incl. the same, higher pressure. Only difference is the clear reservoir, which looks even better.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: WARNING. Be careful using the waterpik on teeth with veneers!
customer_reviews.text: I love how my teeth feel after using the Waterpik. I use the tip for people with crowns and/or implants. Unfortunately, I have a couple of veneers and never thought about the Waterpik removing them..... It did! Right down the drain. I will continue using the Waterpik but will avoid the teeth with veneers, or use a low setting... I did have the waterpik on a high setting-8. A very expensive lesson and I hope this review will save you from the same outcome.
customer_reviews.author: gayleg

customer_reviews.title: Dental hygiene is key to oral health WaterPik helps
customer_reviews.text: Nice design. This version came with a series of piks to address specific dental hygiene procedures. Looking forward to seeing how it performs, and will do a follow up review. I like it, although there is a learning curve to using it without getting water all over yourself or/and the bathroom floor. I also felt that power cord was a bit short, which means limited placement choices, being that the water tube also has a restriction. Perhaps, the design serves as a safety net.
customer_reviews.author: Heart & Soul Concerts

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for me
customer_reviews.text: Started using this, then after a month, went to the dentist. I was asked if I'd been flossing. Started using this, then flossing manually, and this, in my opinion, was not doing the job. Put it under the sink, and haven't used it since. Waste of money for me. May be good for people with dental appliances like braces, or people with periodontal pockets. For them, I'm sure it would be great IN CONJUNCTION WITH REGULAR FLOSSING.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love this....
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has suffered from gum disease all my life and one who has had even my dentists complain that my teeth are hard to floss I wish one of them had recommended this to me at some point along the way. I had thought it would be overkill in conjunction with my Sonicare, but no, it's a great enhancer. Very very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Derifield

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and pretty in blue.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty and easy to use. I bought it on a whim, on special and have been using it daily since. I thought it'd be another gadget to eventually go in a closet but no, it's painless to set up and use. My teeth feel much cleaner. And, bonus, my dentist said the depth of my whatchacallit gum pockets has dramatically improved since I started using it. "Night and day" she said.
customer_reviews.author: BelD

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! This product is junk! I ordered a second replacement because the off and on button stopped working! The replacement has the same issue and then of course I have to waste my time shipping them both back! Test these product's before shipping them and save us all time and money!
customer_reviews.author: David J. Ford

customer_reviews.title: I loved until it DIED!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in April 2017, died today 1/14/18. Used probably every other day, yes I know you should use it every day but clearly that would have shortened it’s life further. It was a good product until it died, suddenly and without dramatics, it just stopped. How does one rate something that was good until it died a sudden early death?
customer_reviews.author: Christine E.

customer_reviews.title: the worst is keeping the water in the sink instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: My mouth never felt so clean & fresh, the worst is keeping the water in the sink instead of everywhere! But, with a bit of practice it the bathroom stayed dry!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Open the floodgates...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe someone can offer me some tips. The concept is great but what a mess! I am unable to operate this without a flood. I followed the directions to a tee. I do not leave the handheld part powered on while I move the device within my mouth. I also lean into my sink as far and close as humanely possible. Add the loud factor and I'm disappointed. Regardless, it's a mess. I will likely keep this because of the benefits. However, if one comes along that is more user friendly, this is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie B.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: It won't turn on, defective product!
customer_reviews.text: When i got the product, it was packed with it's original package only (without any Amazon tough package to protect it) and the sticker which is supposed to keep the package closed was peeled so the package was basically open (see the attached photos). Before opening it i had the feeling it didn't survive the shipment with this thin package and when i tried to turn it on i figured i was right! The product just won't turn on! Now i need to send it back in order to get a replacement, just because of the lousy packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Eyal

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at all!
customer_reviews.text: This does nothing for my teeth. It honestly just makes a bloody mess all over my bathroom. I wouldn't recommend buying this. I also checked with my dentist thinking I was using it wrong and he said he never recommends this brand to any patient because it doesn't really floss your teeth. I wish I would have checked with him before I bought this. Save up and invest in a sonicare instead.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Flosser, but should be used as well as regular flossing
customer_reviews.text: Now I thought I could use this IN PLACE of flossing but after seeing my dentist.. er dental hygienist actually, a water flosser is something that should be used in ADDITION to regular flossing. however, if you have hard water I​ would recommend that you also use filtered or Reverse Osmosis water to fill your reservoir to prevent build up in the water flosser
customer_reviews.author: GALLO

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I purchased because I have braces and it's a pain to floss any other way. I don't have a single regret, I actually see positive results in my gums as well..
customer_reviews.author: Issac

customer_reviews.title: This Product is Lacking Information
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in December 2018. Recently the product has started leaking. Factory representative pointed out it will not hold water and must be emptied after every use. Units will develop leaks over time if water is left in reservoir. PLEASE NOTE: you have to empty after every use as noted by the customer service representatives and noted in factory manual.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ross

customer_reviews.title: Works Well But It Leaks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one leaked all over the place. The second one started leaking after 3 months. But I can't throw it away because my dental hygienist told me my teeth, especially in the back, are easier to clean when I use this Flosser. So now what I do is empty the water tank after EVERY use to make sure there isn't a puddle of water all over the sink counter. The leaking problem is apparently pandemic to this product, but it get's hard-to-reach teeth, so I am stuck with using it.
customer_reviews.author: M. JEFFREY MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to say if it's actually better than flossing, but it's much more enjoyable. This easily became the star of my oral hygiene routine, and I'd probably pick it over brushing if I had to choose. It's made eating popcorn and pork carnitas much more enjoyable, and it's quite satisfying watching a river of food particles flow out from between your teeth. My teeth fell better than they have in a long time, and I'd highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Leaky wand day 1, gusher!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews. Three bullet points. 1. Best on market. 2. Noisy. 3. Leaks. As for 1. Its seemed the wand and cord are cheap materials, so.. it leaked all over! Right out of the box , first go at-it. More water gushed out of every crevice than ever even made it to the tip. Best one avail? Quite sad! As for noisy?grow up and become an adult already! geeez. As 3-leakd, I'll try a 2nd one and add the warranty. If two in a row , I'm done, time to RUN far from this.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Messy and loud
customer_reviews.text: This was our first waterpik. Thing I like: Color scheme multiple heads large water reservoir Small-ish footprint was ok on counter Cleaned hard to reach places between teeth Things I didn’t like: Very loud- think pressure washer for your mouth The water leaked down the handle and made a mess on counters and splashed mirrors The extra tip holder next to reservoir was difficult to access- not ideal for sharing if you need to change tip daily Overall it felt like more trouble then it was worth.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy The Ergonomic Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Waterpik again
customer_reviews.text: Had an older one that stopped working, this one works even better because of the on/off switch on the handle ( older one only had a pause while pressing button).and more convenient storage of other tips next to water container. It's a bit quieter and smaller but with same capacity and I like the designer blue over show stains white or show everything black. I've been water flossing for years because of a bridge, an implant and several crowns plus I also use it on low setting and special tip to place liquid oral medication for a wisdom tooth pocket area which works perfect. Both my dentist and I are very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: jav8r

customer_reviews.title: So far so good combined with a dental pick
customer_reviews.text: Despite being a regular string flosser, I started to develop a cavity between two molars. I've changed my flossing regiment to stave off having a full-fledged cavity -- I now use a dental pick to reach into the gaps to lightly loosen any food and plaque and finish it off with this Waterpik. After three months the affected area seems to have stabilized and the gums in that area are no longer bothersome. I no longer need to buy dental floss either, which saves money in the long run. Without the dental pick the Waterpik alone was not as effective for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis4Ever

customer_reviews.title: if you hate going to the dentist this is the tool to have.
customer_reviews.text: Use this once or twice a week and your in good shape. Use it daily and add some mouthwash to the water, just a dash, or if you have gingivitis look up the recipe for the bleach and water mixture, its like one half teaspoon to a quart of water and what you don't use right then you throw out. it will take care of that too. make sure you rinse the machine out after the bleach with eat it up inside. I didn't see a dentist for 5 years and only had to go because a crown came loose. my teeth were perfect. YES, they still charged me for the 3 minute inspection/cleaning .
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize what I was missing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a necessity. That's how strongly I feel about it after a month of usage. I had regularly used floss and felt that it was adequate, but decided to purchase a Waterpik because it was on sale and I was bored. Wow. This is one of the most important purchases I've made in years. I feel like a good analogy would be to try imagining cleaning the hard-to-reach parts of your vehicle with a rope. You've done it for years because it's all you know. Then enters the pressure washer, which allows you to blast things to smithereens. Floss = rope, Waterpik = pressure washer. Bam. Done. Not going back as long as it works.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: must have item
customer_reviews.text: My first water flosser and despite the fact it's a bit noisy, the unit functions very well, easy to use, and has enough power to get my teeth clean. Its main competition is the panasonic flosser, I have it as well. While the panasonic looks nicer with magnetic handle attach, it doesn't have enough power like the waterpik to get everything clean. Also it's not as easier to change the water than waterpik. I empty out the water after every use, and put the water container by itself to let everything dry/vent.
customer_reviews.author: gaga

customer_reviews.title: It leaks - returned and bought a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a week or two and then, as other reviewers have noted, the tank started leaking. It would even leak out at night when the unit wasn't running. I bought a Vava instead. After three months, the Vava is not leaking.
customer_reviews.author: SerenePDX

customer_reviews.title: Stick to regular dental floss!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a fancy way of washing your mouth but nothing else. I have tried it for 2 weeks, but it doesn’t do anything to food stuck between your teeth. Creates some mess, wire is very short to keep it at a safe distance and then use it, it always felt as if I’ll pull the whole thing into the sink. I find it 50% less effective than regular floss! Amazon support was very nice and refunded the whole amount.
customer_reviews.author: Spender

customer_reviews.title: Great Cleaning Product
customer_reviews.text: This water flosser does a great job of deep cleaning between my teeth, removing residue from the gumline resulting in much better periodontal heath. The one beef I have with this product is the amount the flossing nozzle extends over the main body of the unit. I have accidently hooked my hand or shirt sleeve on this nozzle a number of times which has resulted in spilling the resevior water all over my vanity top and bathroom floor. Waterpik needs to redesign this unit to eliminate this design flaw!
customer_reviews.author: R. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Small size and super quiet make this my favorite Waterpik flosser
customer_reviews.text: My first Waterpik was the Complete Care Water Flosser and Sonic Toothbrush (WP-900) and while I loved it initially, I did not like the noise (enough to wake someone up if you do it late at night) and the tooth brush also tends to get noisy after a year or so of use. This was a HUGE improvement for two reasons: QUIET. It is noticeably more quiet than the WP-900 while this has a low humming sound, the other sounded like a motor. Second reason: SIZE. Almost half the size of the WP-900, it is small and compact yet just as powerful as the WP-900. Very happy with my purchase and would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money ... poor flimsy quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is of insubstantial poor quality plastic. The motor is weak and it does little more thank take up valuable real estate on bathroom counter. I had one of the original WaterPics many years ago. I remember all the gunk that came out from between my teeth. Not so here. This is not even close to a substitute for flossing. It extracts few food particles stuck between teeth. I should have listened to my brother -- a practicing dentist and on faculty at a dental school.
customer_reviews.author: rav

customer_reviews.title: The best water cleaning device for teeth!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a much older model, which worked - but never as well. One of the things the old one did not do that this one does is that this model has a an on/off switch on the handle as well as the base of the unit. You turn on the base and can control when/if you want the water to be jetted out. The pressure of the jet is higher than the old one and seems to clean better. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Purple Griffon

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Floss
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a water floss/pik. I was skeptical at first because I'm so used to the standard method of flossing my teeth, but the water pik didn't disappoint. The water pressure can be adjusted to push particles of food from between your teeth. You can also feel the small stream of water flow between your teeth. The first time I used it, pieces of plague build up started coming off which was amazing because string flossing never provided this benefit. Would recommend to anyone who is curious!
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Yang

customer_reviews.title: Per Dentist Office...
customer_reviews.text: I apparently don't know how to floss (per the crappy hygienist at the new - now old - dentist office). But, hey ho, why not try it. So far, I've only used the regular attachment. It's a bit hard to get used to, as if you aren't paying attention, you'll either spray down your whole bathroom or yourself, or gag on all the water in your mouth! Teeth feel cleaner after use. You can't you the superfine head on anything but 2 per the instructions. Using it on 9-10 is really really LOUD. Wish there was a storage bag/case for the additional heads, so mine are stored in a plastic bag for now.
customer_reviews.author: CPatterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, inconvenient controls but effective
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my dentist for implants and to use mouthwash vs water. This unit leaked initially but seems to have gone away since priming although I’m not sure I trust it. There’s no way this would be for travel as it is too big. This unit is LOUD and not sure if it should be as I have never owned one but loud enough to be annoying. The on off controls on the handle are tricky and I’ve turned it off and on accidentally during use which is a bad thing. It is strong and I like the attachment for implants. I’m not sure I’d recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Digital61

customer_reviews.title: Waterpik Water Flosser
customer_reviews.text: After a friend who is a dental hygenist recommended and I read lots of reviews... decided to purchase and has become my new favorite thing to use daily. Positives: works extremely well, comes with multiple tips to chose from with pamphlet that explains which works best for what you want. Feels like it is deep cleaning. Possible negatives: Is very noisy and have to be careful to remember to not push button to turn on until mouth is fully closed or you will spray everywhere.. Also is too large to travel with.. Overall, Worth the price and feels very effective. Would absolutely recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: kroseo

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: (1) Water supply tubing should be 6” or 8 “ longer. (2) Product is unstable when water container is filled and the power switch is pressed, either on or off. Top heavy. The assembly tends to rock, sloshing the water out of the supply cup. (3) the supply cup material is too flexible. Almost slips out of the hand, when full. (4) pressure might be increased a little to improve deep cleaning. With all of these minor complaints, the product works as advertised, and is relatively quiet compared to competitor products.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: OK! Went to rip off new dentist. said my pockets were #5s and I had to spend $1900 on antibiotic treatments before they would do a preventative cleaning! Well I had moseyed out of that place and decided to get this waterpick device. Well, today I saw new dentist today. My pockets went from #5 to #3 in just a few weeks of using it. Yeee haaaa! $60 compared to $1900!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jordan

customer_reviews.title: NO BRAINER for BRACES
customer_reviews.text: You can research this product as to how it compares to flossing. You will find different study results and opions I get it, flossing will do some things that the water pik might not do and visa versa My kids have braces and trying to floss them by hand is: 1) Gross 2) Difficult at best and impossible towards the back of the mouth I started them on the Waterpik and never looked back. In our experiences, the Waterpik will water floss teeth with braces much more efficiently, faster, better and easier than with string floss. My only complaint, why didn't we do this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Great
customer_reviews.text: This Water flosser is great! It makes my mouth feel so clean and fresh. It's so much easier than flossing. I wish I had gotten one year's ago. I had braces as a kid and they glue in a retainer and it stays in forever I guess. It makes it hard to floss my bottom teeth. This water flosser eliminates the hassle completely. It's quick and doesn't hurt as much as string floss I highly recommend this gadget. Also, it's hilarious to watch others use a water flosser. Get one for the wife or kids as well
customer_reviews.author: EvilBob

customer_reviews.title: Button sticking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water flosser. I'm making my dentist (and me) very happy. I had an issue with the button that controls massage/flossing switchover. It would stick on one or the other modes and I couldn't get it to change over. I got a cotton swab and some distilled vinegar, turned the unit on its side and swabbed around the edges of the button. Voila! button no longer sticks. I also used an eyedropper and dripped some vinegar around all the buttons, on/off and the one that ejects the tips. Everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: Searcher 101

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Adult Orthodontics
customer_reviews.text: I'm an adult and just had periodontal surgery and metal braces done to my teeth. I ordered this item hoping that it would help me keep my teeth clean. I LOVE it! The adjustable pressure is perfect because I can use the higher setting on my uppers, but turn the pressure way down for use on my lowers where I had surgery. Even after brushing, this water pik gets more stuff out of my teeth and makes the braces much more tolerable. I highly recommend this item, especially to those with orthodontic braces.
customer_reviews.author: Just Beachy

customer_reviews.title: THROW OUT THE FLOSS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll tell you, I H-A-T-E-D flossing, never really was gun Ho on doing it, this Waterpik makes it sooo easy. Easy unboxing and setup, you’ll definitely like it, makes flossing a breeze! Adjustable pressure dial makes it more comfortable for those sensitive spots. Has a nice gum massaging function, and the switch on the applicator handle makes it very simple to not make a mess. Much more compact than the pictures let on so if your worried about space, Id say it takes up about as much as a1-Liter bottle. A little tip, make sure to use warm water like it says, it really does make a big difference as far as sensitivity goes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: For people who hate flossing
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for over a year and I love it. I hate flossing, never flossed before I had the water pick. It makes flossing a lot more easy and fun. It actually feels good to floss, it’s like a mouth massage! Lol. I will say it’s a little weird at first and takes some getting used to. I like how they had it come with several different tools to floss with. If you hate flossing and want to take better care of yourself, this is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla P

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvements but ok
customer_reviews.text: Waterpik works great but there are some issues I dont like about the design. First the water runoff on the side of the pik is right above the electrical wires. Second it's hard to clean it and when you use it the water runs down the water hose and makes a mess. Third I had an issue with the water container it was leaking water found a puddle of water on the floor it lasted a month maybe something got stuck
customer_reviews.author: no one

customer_reviews.title: Love this Waterpik- Check which tips are included with your order
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this waterpik. I just got braces and it is amazing. Can't imagine not having this to get into all the nooks and crannies. The only dissapointment is that I did not receive all of the tips. I got the orthodontic, classic jet tip and toothbrush tip. The tips that should have been included with this model were missing ( Plaque seeker, Pik pocket and tongue cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: the pellets do NOT whiten!  They are minty. But nothing in the ingredients is for whitening
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a flosser and the "whitening" was a bonus so I got this one. The machine is very nice, BUT the tablets are NOT for whitening! Only minty fresh. Does NOT whiten! They are minty. But nothing in the ingredients is for whitening.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Works As Promised
customer_reviews.text: We have an irrigator that attaches permanently to the bathroom sink faucet, and that's a nice and convenient product. Wanted this because of the pulsing activity, the different nozzles, and the ability to add something like mouthwash to the water reservoir. The product is reasonably quiet, with little vibration. The reservoir is a reasonable size. The unit takes up minimal counter space. Neither the tank nor the fittings have leaked. Fit and finish of the various parts is good and the product as assembled is stable. This has been a satisfying, good value, acquisition.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Gets so much gunk out - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade - Was worried about getting a larger one than I had previously, but the footprint is still very reasonable, and this thing is GREAT. High capacity, many strength settings, and it gets SO MUCH GUNK out of my teeth. I don't wear braces or dentures, but I do think a water flosser should be part of EVERY dental regime, and this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: Charity June

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: This model replaced my very much older waterpic. My other one was stronger but this appears to be their best model these days and I am getting use to it. It does clean, is easy to use, has several brush choices if you desire, turns off on the handle to pause or stop if needed, and I would recommend it. I tried to put one star for travel but it puts four, so one star for travel, three for deep cleaning, and four stars for easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: suestew

customer_reviews.title: OK product, way over rated.
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but only OK product. It did do a fairly good job of cleaning your teeth. However, the build quality is quite poor. The product feels flimsy and not well manufactured. In addition, you have to be really careful while using it. The tangled wire/tube will make it quite easy to fall off the counter. The plaque removal function is a joke and never worked. Last but not at least, it can really hurt your gum: it does clean well but my gum will sore for a few hours after use.
customer_reviews.author: WZ

customer_reviews.title: So Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my dentist recommended I do so. I wasn't prepared for what it actually is: a teeny, tiny pressure washer. It's so fun! I load it up with lukewarm water, drop in the little whitening tablet, turn it on, and go to town on my teeth. It can shoot across the room it's so powerful. Plus my teeth always feel super clean and white afterwards. I highly recommend this for all use cases where a tiny pressure washer would be appropriate, but definitely for teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Very functional product
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a Waterpik type device before, and I discovered that it takes some getting used to. I'm not sure that I'm ever going to really like it, but that's just me. Having said that, the Waterpik brand device works exactly as designed. I had no issues whatsoever. The unit is easy to use, seems very intuitive, and all the buttons / settings worked perfectly. I really didn't really see anything that I would change or improve. So functionaly, the unit does its work very nicely, will little maintenance. If your in the market for a Waterpik type device, I can say the Waterpik brand would be an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: vfsabre

customer_reviews.title: The only way your teeth feel cleaner is to let your dentist do it.,and that hurts a little.
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason they call all of these things water-pic,it is the top of the line,they arent cheap hence the long anticipated wait for ne but i am not disappointed,now my breath is not so bad I cant face people when i talk and it will definately help with my gum health,as far as operation,there is a steep learning curve you may not wet up uourself and everything in the bathroom like i did the first time but i make less and less mess each use but the way your teeth and gums feel afterwards make you want to do it several times a day,especially after meals,it feels good to have clean teeth and frsh breath
customer_reviews.author: othersaints

customer_reviews.title: Tooth saver!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been really bad about flossing, and as a result have had lots of cavities between my teeth. After my first root canal, I vowed to get one of these, after my second root canal I finally pulled the trigger and ordered this. It works so well! Super easy to use, does have a small learning curve to get used to, but it's mostly just to minimizing the splashing around.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Walton-Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works great, buy it.. you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: You will be amazed at what comes out of your mouth after brushing and flossing with conventional floss. Almost didn't buy the unit because of complaints about the noise level. It's only noisy on the highest pressure setting, even so it is not terrible. It is a water pump putting put high pressure, it's going to make noise. Best buy I have bought in a long time and it will make your dentist happy, saves money due to decreased repairs on your teeth. Great for the gums as well. Excellent product, you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Cleans my teeth really well!
customer_reviews.text: This Waterpik water flosser is extremely good at cleaning my teeth: I was able to remove food particles from between my teeth that I can't remove by brushing and flossing conventionally. Every time I use it I am amazed by the fact that there's so much leftover over between my teeth even after brushing. The best of all, using the Waterpik just feels more fun than using a normal dental floss; I imagine this could be an important factor in making people like me actually floss every day. (I don't feel motivated enough to floss conventionally every day; most people don't.) Looking forward to better oral health in 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very good but prefer the standard unit.
customer_reviews.text: Of used Waterpik for years a swear by it for cleaning and massaging between teeth. The company always seems intent on producing various version of the same product. This unit had to sit on a shelf which was a problem as the hand piece sits quite high. The water reservoir is a bit smaller. I when with the standard white unit on my next purchase (Walgreen's with coupon) and prefer it. The stylish black unit is not really as functional as the standard unit. However, the standard unit puts all the various tips in a lid compartment which is a bad design due to constant filling of water.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Avery

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Leaks water everywhere. Just opened it and it is leaking. I figured most bad reviews were the exception not the rule but apparently I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: eric stidham

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have this, the handleheld version, and the small version for my daughter. I bought them when she and I had braces. My dentist told me during my last cleaning that I was doing a great job of removing plaque, and asked me if I’d had a hard time getting around the braces. I told her I’d been using the waterpik, and she said it was doing a better job than I had flossing! Definitely worth the money. But Be gentle on your gums!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: After owning this waterpick, flossing becomes a pleasure.
customer_reviews.text: This makes flossing a pleasure. It truly cleans and leave your mouth feeling like you just came out from the dentist. I wish the product was smaller, but I love it so much that I don't care any more. I've heard that other brands and other smaller products are not as effective, so I decided to buy this one, which was recommended by multiple friends as the best one. I've also recommended this to family and friends and everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: mariela

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT WON'T SWITCH ON!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to receive my first ever waterflosser! After asking my dentist and friends around, everyone recommended Waterpik. So I did order one. Unfortunately my waterflosser didn't turn on. I followed the user manual step by step, but even the light indicator which should show blue color, didn't turn on. I do hope that the seller will get back to me soon with a solution, or a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Luchaninova

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait until after I visited my Dentist to write a review and well here it is... I went to my Dentist who I've been seeing for the past 15 years and she asked me what did I do differently?! She told me there is almost NO PLAQUE on my teeth!! Both my gums and my teeth were in excellent condition! I have a small pocket in between my wisdom tooth and molar that catches food and starts to smell and become uncomfortable, with one use for only 1 Minute the water pick blasts the particles away. I'll keep on recommending the Waterpik to anyone who will listen ha!
customer_reviews.author: Grungy

customer_reviews.title: So loud! OMG!
customer_reviews.text: It's like having a leaf blower in the bathroom. We have a bathroom that connects to our bedroom, and good luck trying to use this at times when the other person is sleeping. What an atrocious device! We tried dampening the sound by placing a small towel between the unit and the marble counter top, but it is still unbearably loud.
customer_reviews.author: cremophore

customer_reviews.title: Easier than flossing, lots of different options on cleaning tips
customer_reviews.text: Does this work as well as actual flossing? I doubt it, but it comes pretty close. Using the right cleaning tip is key: once you find the one you like and the setting that works for you, using this becomes routine. Careful, though, as this thing has enough power to cut your gums, especially with the more narrow tips. I'd recommend this for people who have difficulty flossing in the back of their mouths, or who (like me) still have their wisdom teeth and find them nearly impossible to floss conventionally.
customer_reviews.author: Danonguitar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this for four months and it has started alternating between floss and massage mode every second. Very annoying considering I only want to use floss mode. I’ve tried unplugging it in hopes it would reset but that didn’t work. When not in use the light constantly alternates between the two modes so the light never stops flashing. I expected more and I certainly expected this to last longer than four months. I’m very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: WHAT I EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended a flosser - specifically Waterpik. I found setup easy and instructions to be clear and straight forward. The devices is easy to use and effective in removing debris in hard to reach places. There are tools for a second person and others that my work well - but I only use the one. I often add a splash of mouthwash to the basin to refresh my palate. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for teeth lovers
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teeth and smile person. I was an inconsistent flosser with regular string, this changed that. You can see the difference. I am by no means an expert or in the field of dentistry- my review is based upon compliments I have received. It removes that little film of plaque that regular brushing and flossing doesn't. My teeth just appear whiter. Whether or not my gums and teeth are healthier, I suppose my dentist will let me know at my next visit. There is a learning curve and it is a bit messy. The process isn't 5 stars but the results are. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Superbly cleans in between teeth
customer_reviews.text: I have not taken care of my teeth for the longest time and recently I have noticed the consequences. So, I decided to do something about it and get this flosser. I am amazed at all the little particles that stay behind but come out after brushing my teeth. I haven't raised the power more than to number five. It works pretty good at that setting. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: DOEN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: if I could give ZERO star, I would've done that. as I bought this to my wife. she tried to connect it to the power, but it does not work. I went up to see if there was an issue. guess what, it just simply DOES NOT WORK. I want my refund and return it. here is another surprise, since I live in Saud Arabia. to send it back, it would cost me 300SAR equivalent to 80$ which is worth more than the machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed S Mussallam

customer_reviews.title: Love the product except!!!
customer_reviews.text: They literally took the product off the self and slapped a label on it! They didn't cover up what it was. I am shocked that I got it. Anyone would know what it was. They could at least put it in a brown paper. I live in an apt and I have not doubt if I was not home the porch pirates would have loved it!!! I love this new product but they need to get with the times!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Sat in my closet for a year
customer_reviews.text: My hygienist recommended I purchase this Water Pik after showing me what was left on my teeth after brushing and flossing but it sat in my closet for a year. Then I decided to put it on the side of my bathtub (I'm strictly a bath person) so I use it there where overspray is no big deal. Oh my gosh it is wonderful. When COVID kept us out of the dentist for a while I wanted to return with a better mouth than I've had in years...and I did. If I could encourage young people to meticulously care for their teeth when young, it will pay off big time later. Guess what my kids are getting for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Karinka

customer_reviews.title: Best Way To Achieve Dental Health
customer_reviews.text: I had owned a battery operated smaller water-flosser, which although easy to use just did NOT have the power to clean between the teeth. I think this Water Pik product is one of the best, (although not 100% happy w/the price.) Well designed, & compact, this Water Pik has good force, several tips & a reservoir that only needs one filling to do your entire mouth. It's a bit messy, but astounding to see the food particles that come out of your teeth after a full flossing w/string floss. Good product for dental hygiene.
customer_reviews.author: Allison K

customer_reviews.title: Make your dentist proud
customer_reviews.text: It’s very loud. I had to move my morning brushing routine to the guest bathroom because my wife can’t handle all that noise so early. It works great though. My dentist notice a big improvement since my last visit ( I had been using an air floss previously). Periodontal pocket depths were never terrible, but showed improvement. They still recommended I floss regularly, every other day or so. I think in tandem with flossing this is great. The waterpik is easy to use and cleans out the gumline in a way flossing cannot. Flossing still gets in some areas between the tooth that the waterpik doesn’t seem to hit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: First time I have used one of these - good but a bit messy
customer_reviews.text: First time purchaser - trying on advice of dentist to reduce plaque. As suggested in instructions, I started out at low setting and gradually increased setting. too early to tell if reducing plaque. These are "messy" and you have to allow water to run out of mouth while using, or spit water out. You must turn off switch on handle if you don't have it aimed at teeth or it will shoot across the room. If on high setting, and you miss your teeth, it can sting a bit when it hits back of throat. These are also somewhat noisy. Had to replace tip after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Gentle but also effective
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's small and portable so that I don't have to leave it on the counter. It really helped ease my pain while I was waiting to get my root canal. On a low setting it massaged my gums for pain management. The deep cleaning head was helpful in getting some of my gums to grow back and stay super clean to avoid an expensive deep-clean at the dentist. I'd recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Yes, please!
customer_reviews.text: This water flossing device is much better, in my opinion, than flossing with dental floss. You begin to realize or remember that your gums pack a to-go sampling every time that you eat something. Dental floss isn’t always able to remove this as effectively as the water flossing. Also, don’t let the reviewers who wrote about water going all over the bathroom derail your plans to purchase it. If you breathe without your mouth hanging open and can figure out how not to drown should you trip and fall face first into a puddle, then you’ll be just fine. You’ll thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: Dentist recommended and we listened, Me and my husband absolutely love this, why we haven’t bought sooner is beyond me but I wish we did, add some mouth wash in and your mouth is clean as can be, like just getting back from the dentist. Heck it knocks out stuff you don’t even know was there. Combine this with the sonicare brushes and it’s heaven! It Works amazingly definitely make sure your over the sink as it takes a few times to become pro and not get water everywhere lol but this was one of my best purchases and feeling how clean my mouth is every day makes it worth it 100 percent.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if it didnt break right away
customer_reviews.text: Overall ill start by saying that the product worked fine and did its job for the first week or so. But the one issue is it no longer works properly and there is no return option on the orders page. There is a hose that connects the pump to the handle, and where the connection is from the hose to the bottom of the handle is secured so poorly from the manufacturer. On mine there is a significant leak which causes all the pressure to be lost before getting to the tip. Even with the pump throttled all the way to the max, it is still ineffective due to the leak. Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will Fail... buy elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: When I received this I absolutely loved it. Barely a month after opening it I am not able to use it at all! When I turn the device on water squirts out of the bottom of the handle. The leak appears to be between the handle and the hose. This is extremely disappointing and unacceptable from a product that is so highly regarded. I have learned my lesson purchasing high ticket items via Amazon. I will purchase a similar item from Costco where I can take it back if it fails. If you plan to take the risk I advise purchasing a protection plan or extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Autonomy1028

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water flosser
customer_reviews.text: Excellent water glosser. Came with lots of different tips, though they are not stored in the lid like my old one. I like the two modes, floss and massage. Bulky and loud, but great for my teeth and gums. I still floss with regular floss, and follow with brushing and the Waterpik. If buying again, I would consider a combo that comes with a travel version, as I missed this on my last trip (and the travel ones are $$ on their own). Also bought one for my son with braces and it is so helpful for keeping his braces and teeth clean. We love it with Periogen powder added.
customer_reviews.author: O. Howard

product_meta.title: Waterpik Water Flosser Electric Dental Countertop Professional Oral Irrigator For Teeth, Aquarius WP-662 Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style Name:AquariusESSENTIAL FOR GOOD ORAL HEALTH
The easy and more effective way to floss, the Waterpik Aquarius Water Flosser features advanced technology and a compact, contemporary design. And it is the first dental water flosser in its class accepted by the American Dental Association (ADA). It cleans deep between teeth and below the gumline where traditional brushing and flossing can't reach, using a unique combination of water pressure and pulsations.

CLINICALLY PROVEN
Removes up to 99.9 percent of plaque 
Up to 50 percent more effective for improving gum health vs. string floss


FEATURES & IN THE BOX
7 color coded flossing tips for multiple family members and needs
Advanced pressure control with 10 settings (10 to 100 PSI) for a custom clean
Reservoir holds 22 ounces of water for 90 seconds of flossing time
Can be used with your favorite mouthwash
On/Off water control on handle
2 Modes Floss and Hydro Pulse Massage
1 minute timer with 30 second pacer
LED information panel
Measures 4.7w x 3.8d x 10.35h (inches, with tip)

VOLTAGE
Compatible with 120VAC/60Hz outlets, for use in North America Only

PRODUCT WARRANTY & SUPPORT
The Waterpik support team based in Fort Collins, Colorado is available to help with any product questions or needs at 1 800 525 2774 or smreviews@waterpik.com. Aquarius is backed by a 3 year manufacturer's warranty.
NOTE : This is our professional series line of products which contain premium features and function to our base line of products.
feature_bullets: EASY & EFFECTIVE: The Waterpik Aquarius water flosser is the easy and most effective way to floss, removing up to 99.9 percent of plaque from treated areas and is up to 50 percent more effective than floss for improving gum health; perfect for braces, implants, and other dental work

TESTED & TRUSTED: Waterpik is clinically proven and the only water flosser brand to earn the American dental association (ADA) Seal of Acceptance. Enjoy healthier gums and brighter teeth in just 1 minute a day

ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: features massage mode for gum stimulation, plus enhanced pressure with 10 settings ranging from 10 to 100 psi for a custom clean. Built in timer/pacer pauses briefly at 30 secs and 1 min to help track flossing time. Delivers 1400 water pulses per minute

HIGH VOLUME RESERVOIR AND FLOW CONTROL: Holds 22 ounces and provides 90 seconds of water capacity: no refilling required. Reservoir is top rack dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. Easily control water flow with the convenient on/off handle switch

7 TIPS FOR MULTIPLE FAMILY MEMBERS AND NEEDS: 3 Classic, 1 Orthodontic, 1 Plaque Seeker for implants and other dental work, 1 Pik Pocket for periodontal pockets, 1 Toothbrush Tip. Tips rotate 360 degrees for easy access to all areas of the mouth

SUPPORT & WARRANTY: Waterpik’s Fort Collins, Colorado support team is available to help with any product questions or needs. The Aquarius Water Flosser is backed by a 3 year warranty. Compatible with 120VAC/60Hz outlets, for use in North America only. Any warranty will be voided through the sale and use of the product outside North America. Shipment outside of North America is prohibited by Waterpik

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
